    Simulate external exposure

    simulate_exposure.Rd

    Simulate external exposure

    Usage

    simulate_exposure(x, mean = "mean", sd = "sd", label = "casn", n = 1000)

    Arguments

    x

    data frame or list of data frames.

    mean

    column name of mean values.

    sd

    column name of standard deviations.

    label

    column name of labeling term, required if x has more than one row.

    n

    simulated sample size.

    Value

    A matrix or list of matrices containing inhalation rates. Matrix columns are named using the values in the label column for more than one data frame row.

    Examples

    data <- split(geo_tox_data$exposure, ~FIPS)

# Single data frame
simulate_exposure(data[[1]], n = 5)
#> [1] 0.000000e+00 6.594557e-08 2.562170e-08 0.000000e+00 5.082199e-08
#> [6] 7.808398e-08 0.000000e+00 6.263525e-08

# List of data frames
simulate_exposure(data[1:3], n = 5)
#> $`37001`
#>         1582-09-8      51-28-5 510-15-6 72-43-5 76-44-8      77-47-4
